General course objectives:
General course objectives
After completion of the course, the student should be able to:
1. Discuss how sustainable value is created in bio-based businesses, taking into account issues relating to the integration between biotechnology and process technology, both in a corporate and a start-up context.
2. Discuss biobusiness problems and solutions in a common bioproduction engineering language.
Learning objectives:
A student who has met the objectives of the course will be able to:
Describe how biotechnological discoveries are translated into scalable bioprocesses (multi-disciplinary knowledge)
Describe how scalable bioprocesses are translated into business opportunities (multi-disciplinary knowledge)
Discuss which types of bio-based businesses are possible and their different requirements
Define the business and regulatory requirements for the implementation of new biotechnology-based or process-based improvements in a corporate context (business case)
Define the business requirements for the implementation of a new bio-based business in a start-up context and scalability (business plan in teams)
Suggest various sources of funding and investment possible to implement innovative ideas
Analyze constraints due to IP in developing business strategy
Analyze constraints due to regulation in the development of business strategy
Analyze constraints due to sustainability in the development of business strategy
